answers.answer: I believe your OB is correct...once pregnancy occurs, PCOS shouldn't affect it because PCOS only really concerns the ovaries and the ability to release a viable egg...once a viable egg is released and fertilized....it no longer should be an issue.    Best of luck with making your decision...it must be tough for you and congrats on your pregnancy!
